results.title: The Water trolley (K)
results.creator_credit: Noel Price, Penny Spence and Nine Network
results.brief_description: When young Paul’s father is badly hurt in an explosion, his mother calls in the Flying Doctor Service and Paul is left to care for the farm. His immediate concern is to fetch water from a nearby property - a task that becomes fraught with difficulties. Based on a story by Colin Thiele.

results.title: The Water trolley
results.creator_credit: Noel Price, Penny Spence and Nine Network (Australia)
results.brief_description: When Paul’s father is badly hurt, the Royal Flying Doctor service has to be called. Paul is left in charge of the farm and must fetch water from a nearby property. This becomes a task fraught with problems. Based on the novel by Colin Thiele, this is an excellent production from the makers of the award winning children’s dramas, “Danny’s egg” and “Banduk”.

results.title: The Water must go somewhere
results.creator_credit: Graham Chase, Malcolm Otton, Roan Hannam and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Illustrates the advance-warning techniques associated with flooding. Also shows methods of evacuation, and consequences of not following evacuation orders. Gives some criticism of the practice of building in areas where flooding is inevitable. Uses actual film footage shot during floods in Richmond, New South Wales.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Graham Chase, Malcolm Otton, Roan Hannam and Film Australia

results.title: The Water dwellers
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Jim Jeffrey, John Hosking and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
A study of the people living and working in the Pittwater area 25 miles north of Sydney, New South Wales.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Water cycle. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork, American Geological Institute and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Illustrates the constant exchange of moisture between air, land and sea. Evaporation, condensation, and the effects of the water cycle on the climate and land are closely examined.
Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: The Water cycle
results.brief_description: The movement of water is traced through its cycle of eternal change from ocean to sky and back again to the ocean. The relation between evaporation, condensation, saturation, and precipitation is explained. Animation is used to explain how the water table is formed, how water passes through plant bodies and returns to the atmosphere. Direct photography vividly shows the surface run-off from raindrop to ocean, and the function of vegetation and damming in controlling this run-off.

results.title: The Watcher in the woods. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Florence Engel Randall and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description:
Edited version of a Disney feature film from the novel by Florence Engel Randall.
When a teenage girl and her family move into a picturesque old English estate, she immediately senses a strange and powerful presence. Suspense and excitement build as the girl begins to piece together clues to solve a haunting mystery. Teacher preview strongly recommended. Gripping story. No other credits available.

results.title: The Wasted years
results.creator_credit: Pierre des Bonnet, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and United Nations
results.brief_description: This film is a comparative study of the current trend of penal system philosophy in three European countries - Austria, Hungary and Denmark. All three are in the process of re-evaluating their approach to the treatment of their offenders. No endorsement is given to any approach

results.title: The Was
results.brief_description: The Was is a sampladelic trip through the neighborhoods of collective memory. Part experimental film and part music video, it is the collaborative meeting of Australian sample artists Soda_Jerk and The Avalanches.

constellations_other.name: Remix and resistance (Since I left you)
constellations_other.description: The Avalanches' music videos are part of a long artistic tradition of reappropriation as a means of reframing perception.
